Package software.leonov.common.util

Class AutoCloser

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.common.util.AutoCloser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    public final class AutoCloser
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    An AutoCloseable that collects AutoCloseable resources and closes them all when it is closed. This class is the AutoCloseable analog to Guava's Closer class. See Guava's Issue 3450, Issue 3068, and Issue 1020 for further discussion.

    AutoCloseable class has two main use cases:

    • When the number of AutoCloseable resources is not known until runtime (e.g. the resources are user supplied).
    • When properly closing all AutoCloseable resources requires nested try-with-resources blocks which make the code too cumbersome.

    This class is intended to be used in the following pattern:

    Java 6 style: 

     final AutoCloser closer = new AutoCloser();
 try {
     final InputStream in = closer.register(...);
     final OutputStream out = closer.register(...);
     ...
 } catch (final Throwable t) {
     throw closer.rethrow(t);
 } finally {
     closer.close();
 }

    Java 7+ try-with-resources style: 

     try (final AutoCloser closer = new AutoCloser()) {
     final InputStream in = closer.register(...);
     final OutputStream out = closer.register(...);
     ...
 }
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

        public <C extends AutoCloseable> C register​(C resource)

      • rethrow

        public RuntimeException rethrow​(Throwable th)
                         throws Exception
        Stores the given throwable and rethrows it as is if it is an Exception, RuntimeException or Error. In the unlikely possibility that it is a Throwable instance, it will be rethrown wrapped in a RuntimeException.

        This method always throws and as such should be called as throw closer.rethrow(e) to ensure the compiler knows that it will throw.

        Parameters:
        th - the given throwable
        Returns:
        this method always throws and as such should be called as throw closer.rethrow(e)
        Throws:
        Exception
